table.style: border: 0px; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;

tr.style: border: 1px #F0F0F0 solid; font-size: 11px; font-family: verdana; vertical-align: top;
border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Significant health events and conditions for people related to the subject relevant in the context of care for the subject.

tr.td: Information about patient's relatives, relevant for patient

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: This records identifiers associated with this family history record that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The person who this history concerns.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The date (and possibly time) when the family history was taken.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAEklEQVR42mP4//0/iYDhP8kAANZ3Y5Ucw2ZoAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Conveys information about family history not specific to individual relations.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: The related person. Each FamilyHistory resource contains the entire family history for a single person.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: This will either be a name or a description. E.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A time period defined by a start and end date and optionally time.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: A sequence of Unicode characters

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: If this resource is indicating that the related person is deceased, then an indicator of whether the person is deceased (yes) or not (no) or the age or age range or description of age at death - can be indicated here. If the reason for death is known, then it can be indicated in the outcome code of the condition - in this case the deceased property should still be set.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: Value of "true" or "false"

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFUlEQVR42mP4////dyAkATD8JxkAANOHY42SD/TOAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates SHALL be valid dates.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: A sequence of Unicode characters

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4////9/8kAYb/JAMA1odjlXxALpEAAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4DwLf/5MAGP6TDADWl2OVL6gPrgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

tr.td: Condition that the related person had

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4DwLf/5MAGP6TDADWl2OVL6gPrgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4DwLf/5MAGP6TDADWl2OVL6gPrgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: Indicates what happened as a result of this condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4DwLfgZBowPCfZAAA06djjQCg3Z8AAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded. For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4DwLfgZBowPCfZAAA06djjQCg3Z8AAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAFElEQVR42mP4DwLfgZBowPCfZAAA06djjQCg3Z8AAAAASUVORK5CYII=)

span.title: A set of ordered Quantities defined by a low and high limit.

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAE0lEQVR42mP4DwLf/5MAGP6TDADWl2OVL6gPrgAAAABJRU5ErkJggg==)

span.title: A sequence of Unicode characters

tr.style: border: 0px; padding:0px; vertical-align: top; background-color: white;

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(data: image/png;base64,iVBORw0KGgoAAAANSUhEUgAAAZAAAAACAQAAAABeHbedAAAAD0lEQVR42mP4TzJgIF0LANmXY523xFiMAAAAAElFTkSuQmCC)

span.title: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

purpose.value: This is the definition for the FamilyHistory resource

short.value: Information about patient's relatives, relevant for patient

formal.value: Significant health events and conditions for people related to the subject relevant in the context of care for the subject.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comments.value:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource
Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

formal.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comments.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

formal.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comments.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

formal.value: This records identifiers associated with this family history record that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
The person who this history concerns.
The date (and possibly time) when the family history was taken.
Conveys information about family history not specific to individual relations.
The related person. Each FamilyHistory resource contains the entire family history for a single person.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: This will either be a name or a description. E.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".
The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).

description.value: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the related person being described in the family history

formal.value: The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.

If this resource is indicating that the related person is deceased, then an indicator of whether the person is deceased (yes) or not (no) or the age or age range or description of age at death - can be indicated here. If the reason for death is known, then it can be indicated in the outcome code of the condition - in this case the deceased property should still be set.

map.value:
player[classCode=LIV, determinerCode=INSTANCE].deceasedInd, deceasedDate (could be URG)
For age, you'd hang an observation off the role

formal.value: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

short.value: Condition that the related person had

formal.value: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

comments.value: there can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions. The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core simplicity for everyone.

formal.value: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.
Indicates what happened as a result of this condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.

description.value: The result of the condition for the patient. E.g. death, permanent disability, temporary disability, etc.

formal.value: Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded. For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.

map.value:
inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="Subject Age at measurement", value<Diagnosis].value[@xsi:typeCode='TS' or 'IVL_TS']
Use originalText for string

formal.value: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

If the reason for death is known, then it can be indicated in the outcome code of the condition - in this case the deceased property should still be set.

For age, you'd hang an observation off the role

The stated language of the resource
The identity of a subject to list family history items for
